ok
i think we go in with what we knew and planned for and explain that this new piece of information alters the estimates considerably
but we’re not sure how until we have more information
what do you think <@U026NB2U2> ?
agree - we’re thinking that we suggest we launch w/ single usage scenario and call out areas where it may expand.

it seems like they’d need a separate discovery phase in which we’d make estimates based on the different laws and regulations for each state. and that would have to be information they provide us with.
agree
let’s craft a response to lindsay today that thanks her for the info and acknowledge that we won’t have time to completely understand the implications for tomorrow.
but that we’ll craft some thoughts around which to constrain our proposal
i’ll draft something and send to you/charles/evans for review

please send thoughts <@U026NB2U2> <@U06DFL7BP> <@U0260V4K1> <@U026PHQ3J>

I like it, I'd like to make sure we mention both that 1) we didn't necessarily take this into account in any real way before friday except that the system in general _should_ be flexible enough for it 2) we don't know what all it will effect from a tech standpoint without understanding what solve they found and what regulation changes there might be with different play types
yeah, not just backend, but different interaction systems etc
but other than that :thumbsup:
about to read - sorry i missed this -
<!channel>: just fyi - after talking with Evans a little more I realized that I hadn’t included enough time for IA+design on the CMS part of things
so ewald and I have updated the spreadsheet accordingly
i like the email w/ Evans’ feedback incorporated.
thanks for drafting it
ok

with edits: 

Hey Lindsay, 

We're looking forward to meeting tomorrow. The work is coming together nicely. Justin and I are excited to walk you and Ashby through it!

Before we meet, I wanted to touch on the update you shared with us last week around Long Game finding a way to operate in every state. First, wow! That's exciting. Justin expressed already, but we all believe in Long Game's mission and think it has the potential to affect a lot of positive change.

In discussing this update we realized some implications. For example, the backend architecture was not drafted to operate differently on a state by state basis. It should be flexible enough for it, but without knowing the solve for each state it's impossible for us to know exactly how that might impact the tech end of things. 

The same can be said for design since it sounds like some states may need different games. As you can imagine, this presents a unique challenge in scoping a second phase of the project. 

In the spirit of aligning expectations for tomorrow's meeting I wanted to give you the heads up that we will present a product roadmap with second phase that would conclude in launching with a single usage scenario. 

Hope our reasoning here makes sense. Happy to hear any questions you may have tomorrow if not. 

Also, does the room we're meeting in have a phone? I'd like to dial in Marce, David, and Jenny. Let me know when you have a moment!

Thanks!

Amanda
:thumbsup:
thanks!
<!channel> - are we doing this review meeting?
